name: Scaleguard Sentinels
text:
As an additional cost to cast Scaleguard Sentinels, you may reveal a Dragon card from your hand.
Scaleguard Sentinels enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if you revealed a Dragon card or controlled a Dragon as you cast Scaleguard Sentinels.

name: Scale of Chiss-Goria
text:
Flash
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
{T}: Target creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

name: Scalpelexis
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Scalpelexis deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top four cards of his or her library. If two or more of those cards have the same name, repeat this process.

name: Scandalmonger
text: {2}: Target player discards a card. Any player may activate this ability but only any time he or she could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: Silence costs extra. Breaking it costs extra still.

name: Scapegoat
text:
As an additional cost to cast Scapegoat, sacrifice a creature.
Return any number of target creatures you control to their owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "Enjoy your deception, Vuel," Gerrard said as Volrath's features melted from the dead shapeshifter. "I'll count this one as practice."

name: Scapeshift
text: Sacrifice any number of lands. Search your library for up to that many land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"Changes far greater than the turning of the leaves await us at season's end."
â€”Colfenor, the Last Yew

name: Scar
text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor:
"What is a scar? A sign of courage in the face of danger? A mere trick of flesh? Or a constant reminder of agonizing pain, and the follies of war."
â€”Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Scarab of the Unseen
text: {T}, Sacrifice Scarab of the Unseen: Return all Auras attached to target permanent you own to their owners' hands. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Scarblade Elite
text: {T}, Exile an Assassin card from your graveyard: Destroy target creature.

editions.flavor: "Rejoice, eyeblight. In your last hours above the earth, those who bury you will finally make you beautiful."

name: Scarecrone
text:
{1}, Sacrifice a Scarecrow: Draw a card.
{4}, {T}: Return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Her poppets bring joy to the truly depraved.

name: Scarecrow
text: {6}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by creatures with flying.

editions.flavor: There was more malice in its button eyes than should have been possible in something that had never known life.
There was more malice in its button eyes than should have been possible in something that had never known life.

name: Scare Tactics
text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Fear rules those weak enough to accept it."
â€”Greven il-Vec

name: Scarland Thrinax
text: Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Scarland Thrinax.

editions.flavor:
"There is only one way of life in Jund: feed on the weak until you are cut down by something stronger."
â€”Jorshu of Clan Nel Toth

"There is only one way of life in Jund: feed on the weak until you are cut down by something stronger."
â€”Jorshu of Clan Nel Toth

name: Scarmaker
text: Remove a ki counter from Scarmaker: Target creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

name: Scarred Puma
text: Scarred Puma can't attack unless a black or green creature also attacks.

editions.flavor: It's not eager to lose the other eye.

name: Scarred Vinebreeder
text: {2}{B}, Exile an Elf card from your graveyard: Scarred Vinebreeder gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: For disfigured elves, there are few choices beyond death or nettlevine.

name: Scarscale Ritual
text:
As an additional cost to cast Scarscale Ritual, put a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control.
Draw two cards.

editions.flavor: Some words are too important to trust to something as fragile as memory.

name: Scars of the Veteran
text:
You may exile a white card from your hand rather than pay Scars of the Veteran's mana cost.
Prevent the next 7 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.

name: Scarwood Bandits
text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{2}{G}, {T}: Unless an opponent pays {2}, gain control of target artifact for as long as Scarwood Bandits remains on the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Larger and more cunning than most Goblins, Scarwood Goblins are thankfully found only in isolated pockets.

name: Scarwood Hag
text:
{G}{G}{G}{G}, {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{T}: Target creature loses forestwalk until end of turn.

name: Scarwood Treefolk
text: Scarwood Treefolk enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: To treefolk's sense of time, ages pass as hours. They stood as witnesses to the apocalypse, the years of which they saw as one cacophonous, ultra-destructive moment.

"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
â€”Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Scatter Arc
text:
Counter target noncreature spell.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Should your chosen emissary be able to fluctuate triharmonic pentodes, however unlikely, I shall shunt excess negavolt radicals."

name: Scattering Stroke
text: Counter target spell. Clash with an opponent. If you win, at the beginning of your next main phase, you may add an amount of {C} to your mana pool equal to that spell's converted mana cost. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Scattershot
text:
Scattershot deals 1 damage to target creature.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

name: Scattershot Archer
text: {T}: Scattershot Archer deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.

editions.flavor: To train her elves for war, Mayael would drop a sackful of acorns from the tree canopy. Each archer tried to split as many as possible before the acorns hit the forest floor below.

name: Scatter the Seeds
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Create three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.

editions.flavor: From the seeds of faith, great forests grow.
From the seeds of faith, great forests grow.

name: Scatter to the Winds
text:
Counter target spell.
Awaken 3â€”{4}{U}{U} (If you cast this spell for {4}{U}{U}, also put three +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)

name: Scavenged Weaponry
text:
Enchant creature
When Scavenged Weaponry enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.

editions.flavor: "The Phyrexians have progressed," admired Urza. "Their parts are interchangeable."

name: Scavenger Drake
text:
Flying
Whenever another creature dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Scavenger Drake.

editions.flavor: Dragons consider drakes to be mockeries of their perfection, destroying them on sight.
Dragons consider drakes to be mockeries of their perfection, destroying them on sight.

name: Scavenger Folk
text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: String, weapons, wax, or jewelsâ€”it makes no difference. Leave nothing unguarded in Scarwood.

"Stoop, pick, turn, toss.
This is the way we mourn our loss."
â€”Scavenger dirge
"One piece? Now there's a hundred!"
String, weapons, wax, or jewelsâ€”it makes no difference. Leave nothing unguarded in Scarwood.

name: Scavenging Ghoul
text:
At the beginning of each end step, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature that died this turn.
Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.

name: Scavenging Ooze
text: {G}: Exile target card from a graveyard. If it was a creature card, put a +1/+1 counter on Scavenging Ooze and you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: In nature, not a single bone or scrap of flesh goes to waste.
In nature, not a single bone or scrap of flesh goes to waste.
In nature, not a single bone or scrap of flesh goes to waste.
In nature, not a single bone or scrap of flesh goes to waste.

name: Scavenging Scarab
text: Scavenging Scarab can't block.

editions.flavor: The beetles feed not on the flesh of corpses but on the metal, grinding out the iron and steel to add to their own bulky shells.

name: Scent of Brine
text: Reveal any number of blue cards in your hand. Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card revealed this way.

name: Scent of Cinder
text: Reveal any number of red cards in your hand. Scent of Cinder deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

name: Scent of Ivy
text: Reveal any number of green cards in your hand. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

name: Scent of Jasmine
text: Reveal any number of white cards in your hand. You gain 2 life for each card revealed this way.

name: Scent of Nightshade
text: Reveal any number of black cards in your hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

name: Scepter of Dominance
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target permanent.

editions.flavor:
"Whether or not you will bow to me is not open to debate. The question is, will I ever let you rise?"
â€”Fridius, telemin master

name: Scepter of Empires
text: {T}: Scepter of Empires deals 1 damage to target player. It deals 3 damage to that player instead if you control artifacts named Crown of Empires and Throne of Empires.

editions.flavor:
"With this scepter, smite your enemies."
â€”Scepter inscription

name: Scepter of Fugue
text: {1}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

editions.flavor: One goes to Tidehollow either to forget or to be forgotten. Either way, the scullers will oblige.

name: Scepter of Insight
text: {3}{U}, {T}: Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"The road to truth has many branches, and so must the cane with which I walk it."
â€”Voln the Elder

name: Schismotivate
text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -4/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"I ran the experiment through the brain of a schizophrenic lab-goblin. My burners' flames fell asleep while the beakers jumped about and shattered. Success!"
â€”Myznar, Izzet psychomancer

name: Scholar of Athreos
text: {2}{B}: Each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

editions.flavor: She asks pointed questions of the dead who wait for Athreos, learning of life from those who are about to leave it.

name: School of Piranha
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice School of Piranha unless you pay {1}{U}.

editions.flavor: Some schools aren't worth getting into.

name: School of the Unseen
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: After the terrible retribution visited upon Lat-Nam, this school of mages chose to hide from the eyes of the world.

name: Scion of Darkness
text:
Trample
Whenever Scion of Darkness deals combat damage to a player, you may put target creature card from that player's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

name: Scion of Glaciers
text: {U}: Scion of Glaciers gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"There is nothing so free as the spring river born of winter's ice."

text:
Flash
Flying
Other Faerie creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other Faeries you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)

name: Scion of the Ur-Dragon
text:
Flying
{2}: Search your library for a Dragon permanent card and put it into your graveyard. If you do, Scion of the Ur-Dragon becomes a copy of that card until end of turn. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: "I am the blood of the ur-dragon, coursing through all dragonkind."

name: Scion of the Wild
text: Scion of the Wild's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.

editions.flavor: It has a hundred thousand extinctions to avenge.
It has a hundred thousand extinctions to avenge.

name: Scion of Ugin
text: Flying

editions.flavor: For hundreds of years Ugin slept, encased in the cocoon of stone and magic Sarkhan had created using a shard of a Zendikari hedron. As Ugin lay dormant, his spectral guardians kept vigil.

name: Scion of Vitu-Ghazi
text: When Scion of Vitu-Ghazi enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, create a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying, then populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

name: Scion Summoner
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
When Scion Summoner enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature token. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C} to your mana pool." ({C} represents colorless mana.)

name: Scissors Lizard
text: Paper Tigers cannot attack or block.

editions.flavor: Nothing beats the lizard's shear power.

name: Scorched Earth
text:
As an additional cost to cast Scorched Earth, discard X land cards.

name: Scorched Rusalka
text: {R}, Sacrifice a creature: Scorched Rusalka deals 1 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: Each small blaze she sets jogs her memory, letting her piece together the mystery of her own fiery end.
Each small blaze she sets jogs her memory, letting her piece together the mystery of her own fiery end.

name: Scorching Lava
text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Scorching Lava deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If Scorching Lava was kicked, that creature can't be regenerated this turn and if it would die this turn, exile it instead.

name: Scorching Missile
text:
Scorching Missile deals 4 damage to target player.
Flashback {9}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Scorching Spear
text: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Lift your spear as you might lift your glass, and toast your enemy.
Lift your spear as you might lift your glass, and toast your enemy.

name: Scorching Winds
text:
Cast Scorching Winds only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Scorching Winds deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

name: Scorch the Fields
text: Destroy target land. Scorch the Fields deals 1 damage to each Human creature.

editions.flavor:
"Your fields will turn as black as a ghoul's tongue and fire shall be your only harvest."
â€”Minaldra, the Vizag Atum

name: Scorchwalker
text: Bloodrush â€” {1}{R}{R}, Discard Scorchwalker: Target attacking creature gets +5/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Borborygmos's elemental launched an assault, but the Izzet wards held and experiments continue."
â€”Skyknight report on the Rubblebelt

name: Scoria Cat
text: Scoria Cat gets +3/+3 as long as you control no untapped lands.

editions.flavor: Like a volcano, it too can erupt without warning.
A single molten cord links it to the subterranean furnaces, drawing heat and metal from beneath Kuldotha. Until that bond is cut, it carves a swath of raw destruction.

name: Scoria Wurm
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, return Scoria Wurm to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Late at night, ululations echo from deep under Shiv, as the wurms sing of times older than humanity.
Late at night, ululations echo from deep under Shiv, as the wurms sing of times older than humanity.

name: Scorned Villager
text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Scorned Villager.

editions.flavor: "My village's fear drove me into the wild . . ."

name: Scornful Aether-Lich

Flying

text: {1}: Scrapbasket becomes all colors until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Once a tool of kithkin farmers, scarecrows of all shapes now skitter and lurch across Shadowmoor, animated by residual rustic magics.
